Description: Fruits is cultivated in Northern Karnataka. It is important locally for food and income and adapted to local climate and soils. Major producing districts include Bagalkot, Belagavi, Bidar, Dharwad, Gadag, Haveri, Kalaburagi, Koppal, Raichur, Vijayapura, Yadgir, Vijayanagara.
How_to_Grow:
1. Soil type (ಮಣ್ಣು): red or black ಮಣ್ಣು (ಕೆಂಪು/ಕಪ್ಪು ಮಣ್ಣು) with variable fertility; improve with organic matter.

2. Land preparation (ನೆಲ ಸಿದ್ಧತೆ): Plough 2–3 times, remove weeds and level the field. Incorporate well-rotted farmyard manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ) or compost into the topsoil.

3. Sowing time (ಬಿತ್ತನೆ ಸಮಯ): Semi-arid — sow with onset of monsoon and plan for supplemental irrigation (ನೀರಾವರಿ) during dry spells.

4. Seed rate & spacing (ಬೀಜ ಪ್ರಮಾಣ ಮತ್ತು ಅಂತರ): Use recommended seed rates from KVK/UAS.

5. Fertilizer & manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ ಮತ್ತು ಎರೆವು): Apply FYM and balanced NPK based on soil test.

6. Watering schedule (ನೀರಾವರಿ): Water as per crop stage; use drip ನೀರಾವರಿ where possible.

7. Weeding and interculture (ಕೊಳೆ ತೆಗೆಯುವುದು): Timely weeding and mulching helps conserve moisture.

8. Pest & disease control (ಕೀಟ/ರೋಗ): Follow IPM and use neem-based (ನಿಂಬೆ) biopesticides for minor pests.

9. Harvesting (ಕೊಯ್ದು): Harvest at maturity and dry/store properly.
Economic_Importance: Fruits supports local food and income needs in Northern Karnataka; market value depends on quality and access to buyers.
Uses: Used for food, feed or processing depending on crop; residues generally returned to soil as mulch or used as fodder.

How_to_Grow:
1. Soil type (ಮಣ್ಣು): red or black ಮಣ್ಣು (ಕೆಂಪು/ಕಪ್ಪು ಮಣ್ಣು) with variable fertility; improve with organic matter.

2. Land preparation (ನೆಲ ಸಿದ್ಧತೆ): Plough 2–3 times, remove weeds and level the field. Incorporate well-rotted farmyard manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ) or compost into the topsoil.

3. Sowing time (ಬಿತ್ತನೆ ಸಮಯ): Semi-arid — sow with onset of monsoon and plan for supplemental irrigation (ನೀರಾವರಿ) during dry spells.

4. Seed rate & spacing (ಬೀಜ ಪ್ರಮಾಣ ಮತ್ತು ಅಂತರ): Use recommended seed rates from KVK/UAS.

5. Fertilizer & manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ ಮತ್ತು ಎರೆವು): Apply FYM and balanced NPK based on soil test.

6. Watering schedule (ನೀರಾವರಿ): Water as per crop stage; use drip ನೀರಾವರಿ where possible.

7. Weeding and interculture (ಕೊಳೆ ತೆಗೆಯುವುದು): Timely weeding and mulching helps conserve moisture.

8. Pest & disease control (ಕೀಟ/ರೋಗ): Follow IPM and use neem-based (ನಿಂಬೆ) biopesticides for minor pests.

9. Harvesting (ಕೊಯ್ದು): Harvest at maturity and dry/store properly.
Economic_Importance: Bajra (pearl millet) supports local food and income needs in Northern Karnataka; market value depends on quality and access to buyers.
Uses: Used for food, feed or processing depending on crop; residues generally returned to soil as mulch or used as fodder.
Major_Districts: Bagalkot, Belagavi, Bidar, Dharwad, Gadag, Haveri, Kalaburagi, Koppal, Raichur, Vijayapura, Yadgir, Vijayanagara

1. Soil type (ಮಣ್ಣು): red or black ಮಣ್ಣು (ಕೆಂಪು/ಕಪ್ಪು ಮಣ್ಣು) with variable fertility; improve with organic matter.

2. Land preparation (ನೆಲ ಸಿದ್ಧತೆ): Plough 2–3 times, remove weeds and level the field. Incorporate well-rotted farmyard manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ) or compost into the topsoil.

3. Sowing time (ಬಿತ್ತನೆ ಸಮಯ): Semi-arid — sow with onset of monsoon and plan for supplemental irrigation (ನೀರಾವರಿ) during dry spells.

4. Seed rate & spacing (ಬೀಜ ಪ್ರಮಾಣ ಮತ್ತು ಅಂತರ): Use recommended seed rates from KVK/UAS.

5. Fertilizer & manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ ಮತ್ತು ಎರೆವು): Apply FYM and balanced NPK based on soil test.

6. Watering schedule (ನೀರಾವರಿ): Water as per crop stage; use drip ನೀರಾವರಿ where possible.

7. Weeding and interculture (ಕೊಳೆ ತೆಗೆಯುವುದು): Timely weeding and mulching helps conserve moisture.

8. Pest & disease control (ಕೀಟ/ರೋಗ): Follow IPM and use neem-based (ನಿಂಬೆ) biopesticides for minor pests.

9. Harvesting (ಕೊಯ್ದು): Harvest at maturity and dry/store properly.
Economic_Importance: Coriander supports local food and income needs in Northern Karnataka; market value depends on quality and access to buyers.
Uses: Used for food, feed or processing depending on crop; residues generally returned to soil as mulch or used as fodder.
Major_Districts: Bagalkot, Belagavi, Bidar, Dharwad, Gadag, Haveri, Kalaburagi, Koppal, Raichur, Vijayapura, Yadgir, Vijayanagara

Description: Groundnut (peanut) (Arachis hypogaea) is cultivated in Northern Karnataka. It is important locally for food and income and adapted to local climate and soils. Major producing districts include Bagalkot, Belagavi, Bidar, Dharwad, Gadag, Haveri, Kalaburagi, Koppal, Raichur, Vijayapura, Yadgir, Vijayanagara.
How_to_Grow:
1. Soil type (ಮಣ್ಣು): red or black ಮಣ್ಣು (ಕೆಂಪು/ಕಪ್ಪು ಮಣ್ಣು) with variable fertility; improve with organic matter.

2. Land preparation (ನೆಲ ಸಿದ್ಧತೆ): Plough 2–3 times, remove weeds and level the field. Incorporate well-rotted farmyard manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ) or compost into the topsoil.

3. Sowing time (ಬಿತ್ತನೆ ಸಮಯ): Semi-arid — sow with onset of monsoon and plan for supplemental irrigation (ನೀರಾವರಿ) during dry spells. Best sowing: June–July for Kharif; for irrigated crop sow in Dec–Jan.

4. Seed rate & spacing (ಬೀಜ ಪ್ರಮಾಣ ಮತ್ತು ಅಂತರ): Use 75–80 kg seed per acre; sow 2 inches deep. Spacing: ~30 cm between rows and ~10 cm between plants.

5. Fertilizer & manure (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ ಮತ್ತು ಎರೆವು): Apply well-rotted FYM (ಗೊಬ್ಬರ) 5–10 t/ha at planting. Apply phosphorus at sowing (DAP) and gypsum (200 kg/ha) where needed; avoid excess nitrogen.

6. Watering schedule (ನೀರಾವರಿ): In rainfed areas rely on monsoon; provide supplemental ನೀರಾವರಿ every 10–15 days during flowering and pod fill. Stop watering ~10 days before harvest.

7. Weeding and interculture (ಕೊಳೆ ತೆಗೆಯುವುದು): Weed at 20 and 40 days after sowing; mulching (ಮುಲ್ಚಿಂಗ್) helps retain moisture and reduce weeds.

8. Pest & disease control (ಕೀಟ/ರೋಗ): Watch for leaf spots, tikka and pod borer; use certified seed (ಪ್ರಮಾಣಿತ ಬೀಜ) and apply neem oil (ನಿಂಬೆ ಎಣ್ಣೆ) or recommended fungicides as needed. Dry pods thoroughly to avoid aflatoxin.

9. Harvesting (ಕೊಯ್ದು): Harvest when leaves yellow and pods mature; pull plants, sun-dry pods and store in dry bags.
Economic_Importance:
Groundnut is a valuable oilseed crop for Northern Karnataka. It supports small and medium farmers by supplying seeds for oil extraction, snacks and cattle feed. Local oil mills and traders buy the
produce, providing cash income and seasonal labour.
Uses:
Groundnuts are consumed roasted, boiled, or used in sweets and chutneys. Oil extracted is used for cooking; residual cake (after oil extraction) is a high-protein cattle feed and shells are used as
organic manure (ಕೃಷಿ ಗೊಬ್ಬರ).
Major_Districts: Bagalkot, Belagavi, Bidar, Dharwad, Gadag, Haveri, Kalaburagi, Koppal, Raichur, Vijayapura, Yadgir, Vijayanagara
